meanings.definition: To arrange or schedule according to a plan or set of instructions.
meanings.sent1: She programmed her alarm clock to wake her up at 7 AM.
meanings.sent2: The TV was programmed to turn off automatically after midnight.
meanings.sent3: He programmed his cat to expect treats every time he opened the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The teacher programmed the students to raise their hands before speaking.
meanings.sent5: The chef programmed the oven to preheat before baking the cake.

meanings.definition: To input coded instructions into a computer or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: He programmed the new software into the computer system.
meanings.sent2: The technician programmed the remote control to operate the TV.
meanings.sent3: She programmed her phone to play a funny sound whenever she received a message.
meanings.sent4: The engineer programmed the robot to perform a series of tasks.
meanings.sent5: The student programmed the calculator to solve complex math problems.

meanings.definition: To condition or influence someone's thoughts or behavior through repeated exposure.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement programmed consumers to crave the new product.
meanings.sent2: The constant exposure to violence on TV can program children to be desensitized.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said his mom programmed him to always say please and thank you.
meanings.sent4: The catchy jingle programmed people to remember the brand.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist programmed the volunteer to cluck like a chicken on command.
